dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but seriously, like, can a president just decide who gets a ten-billion-dollar government contract based on, what, a personal grudge?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but seriously, like, can a president just decide who gets a ten-billion-dollar government contract based on, what, a personal grudge?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post, which Trump claims publishes unfair and negative coverage about him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, apparently, right? Amazon is basically saying yes, that's exactly what happened here. And they are not backing down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, apparently, right? Amazon is basically saying yes, that's exactly what happened here. And they are not backing down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract by calling for testimony from the president and Defense Secretary Mark Esper, according to court documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No! They're going all in! They want Trump, they want Esper... even Mattis? Like, sworn testimony from a former Defense Secretary?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! They're going all in! They want Trump, they want Esper... even Mattis? Like, sworn testimony from a former Defense Secretary?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a filing with the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, Amazon Web Services asked a judge to allow depositions from Trump, Esper, former Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and Defense Department Chief Information Officer Dana Deasy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! They're hitting everyone, uh, involved. They're saying Trump, you know, used his position as Commander-in-Chief to punish Jeff Bezos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! They're hitting everyone, uh, involved. They're saying Trump, you know, used his position as Commander-in-Chief to punish Jeff Bezos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has repeatedly demonstrated his willingness to use his position as President and Commander in Chief to interfere with government functionsincluding federal procurementsto advance his personal agenda, an AWS spokesperson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Because of the Washington Post, right? He called him "Jeff Bozo" on Twitter! Remember that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because of the Washington Post, right? He called him Jeff Bozo on Twitter! Remember that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The filing cites Trumps tweets attacking Bezos, including one calling him Jeff Bozo, and a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's it! And remember that book from Mattis's speechwriter? It literally said Trump wanted to, like, "screw Amazon out of the contract."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's it! And remember that book from Mattis's speechwriter? It literally said Trump wanted to, like, screw Amazon out of the contract.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The filing cites Trumps tweets attacking Bezos, including one calling him Jeff Bozo, and a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! It's wild. And this confidential DoD memo, apparently, it explicitly states Trump wanted to "punish Amazon"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! It's wild. And this confidential DoD memo, apparently, it explicitly states Trump wanted to punish Amazon?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, that's the big one, isn't it? Like, proof of direct political interference. Ten billion dollars we're talking about!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, that's the big one, isn't it? Like, proof of direct political interference. Ten billion dollars we're talking about!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Pentagon originally, uh, preferred Amazon for this contract anyway! Before all this, like, alleged White House meddling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Pentagon originally, uh, preferred Amazon for this contract anyway! Before all this, like, alleged White House meddling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? The initial assessment favored them! It's just so blatant, the whole thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? The initial assessment favored them! It's just so blatant, the whole thing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they're demanding all the emails, all the documents... court-ordered discovery!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're demanding all the emails, all the documents... court-ordered discovery!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is also asking for court-ordered discovery, meaning the company wants the Trump administration to hand over documents and emails relating to the contract.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep! They want the Trump administration to hand over everything. They are not playing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep! They want the Trump administration to hand over everything. They are not playing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is also asking for court-ordered discovery, meaning the company wants the Trump administration to hand over documents and emails relating to the contract.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's, uh, it's such a mess, and so public.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, uh, it's such a mess, and so public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Messy, yes. But wow, the stakes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Messy, yes. But wow, the stakes.
